article:
'Music education' is a field of study associated with the teaching and learning
of music. It touches on all domains of learning, including the psychomotor
domain (the development of skills), the cognitive domain (the acquisition of
knowledge), and, in particular and significant ways, the affective domain,
including music appreciation and sensitivity. The incorporation of music
training from preschool to postsecondary education is common in most nations
because involvement in music is considered a fundamental component of human
culture and behavior. Music, like language, is an accomplishment that
distinguishes us as humans. Yudkin, J. (2008). Understanding Music (p. 4).
Upper Saddle River, NJ:Pearson/Prentice Hall.
headings: History of music education in the United States
